events.text: say somebody comes here and threatens to blows up the Structure. what would you do?
just like that? don't you care about it?  what if they destroy it?
of course i care. and that's precisely why i don't worry.
they can't. the structure is indestructible.
...not long ago, just said the structure is impossible to fathom.
if that is so, how can you know that it is also indestructible?
well, my dear, what does it matter? i'll never convince you, will i? you don't want to believe.
convincing uses words, and words cannot touch the structure itself.
i cannot convince, or teach, or anything else; you must find the truth on your own.
the truth that you already have revealed to me just now, but is still false;
until it blooms by itself inside me, when it transforms itself and becomes true?
truth always comes from error. anxiety never lies.
that which cannot be named always harbors some kernel of the real.
you must get used to the real.
